text: Anyone know why I would get this error trying to create a new HubDB table

Hi <@U025B07VD7A>
On the free plan, this doesn't work. You will need a Pro package.
Turns out I didn't have the right permissions, So a *bug* in HubSpot allowing me to get this far

Hi everyone! I having some issues with the design manager that I’m not sure how to solve. Basically, after making changes to my template, I press the publish changes button, but it shows me that it has errors and doesn’t allow me to save it. And on the error console, don’t shows what is the error, just *Error: Cannot resolve property.*

Any clue how I can check the error for real and them fix to save? I’m using Clean 6…Actually I used many times the theme, and never happens this. Now I updated for the 6.1 and I can not work on the customizations because of this.

Thanks!  cc/ <@UA5DFM7CK>
Hey! There is a little red error icon in the lower left hand side of the screen.  Toggle that up and it will show you which line you introduce an error on.
<@UA5DFM7CK> I got it now, but is not making too much sense for me, cuz I duplicated the template to make the changes (and maintain the default one as backup for sure) :sweat_smile:
You'll want to address the ones highlighted in red. Those prevent you from saving.
Sure, but I’m confusing about the doctype html for example, why is tagged as error, is not suppose to, right?
Which template are you seeing that <!doctype> in so I can take a look on my end?
I never use your default templates, then I duplicated and renamed…but I can’t not correct those errors, cuz It’s saying that is read-only
